Sentence.value: Parapneumonic pleural effusion is a buildup of fluid between layers of the tissue lining the lung and the chest cavity, which develops when a person has pneumonia.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Parapneumonic pleural effusion is a buildup of fluid between layers of the tissue lining the lung and the chest cavity, which develops when a [[person|C0027361]] has [[pneumonia|C0032285]].

Sentence.value: Pneumonia, most commonly from bacteria, causes parapneumonic pleural effusion.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Pneumonia, most commonly from [[bacteria|C0004611]], causes parapneumonic [[pleural effusion|C0032227]].
